info.title: About Sleep Cycles
info.description: Sleep occurs in cycles of approximately 90 minutes. Waking up at the end of a sleep cycle helps you feel more rested and alert. This calculator helps you find the best times to sleep or wake up based on these natural cycles.
info.cycleDescription: Throughout the night, you go through 4-6 sleep cycles. Each cycle has different stages: light sleep, deep sleep, and REM sleep. Waking up during deep sleep can make you feel groggy and tired. This calculator accounts for 14 minutes to fall asleep and suggests wake times at the end of complete sleep cycles.
info.tip1: Adults typically need 7-9 hours of sleep (5-6 complete cycles)
info.tip2: Keep a consistent sleep schedule, even on weekends
info.tip3: Avoid caffeine and screens at least 1 hour before bed
info.tip4: Create a comfortable environment: dark, quiet, and cool (60-67Â°F)
